intro: Myosotis californica, commonly known as the California forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate blue or purple flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodland areas and stream banks. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is known for its short stature, usually reaching heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The flowers bloom in spring and early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
